     96     <h2 id="introduction">
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
     97       Introduction
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
     98     </h2>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
     99     <p>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    100       Many C++ developers miss an easy and portable way of handling Unicode encoded
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    101       strings. The original C++ Standard (known as C++98 or C++03) is Unicode agnostic.
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    102       C++11 provides some support for Unicode on core language and library level:
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    103       u8, u, and U character and string literals, char16_t and char32_t character types,
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    104       u16string and u32string library classes, and codecvt support for conversions
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    105       between Unicode encoding forms.
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    106       In the meantime, developers use third party libraries like ICU, OS specific capabilities, or simply
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    107       roll out their own solutions.
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    108     </p>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    109     <p>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    110       In order to easily handle UTF-8 encoded Unicode strings, I came up with a small
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    111       generic library. For anybody used to work with STL algorithms and iterators, it should be
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    112       easy and natural to use. The code is freely available for any purpose - check out
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

    440       This function has two purposes: one is two iterate backwards through a UTF-8
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

    442       since <code>utf8::next</code> is faster. The second purpose is to find a beginning
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    443       of a UTF-8 sequence if we have a random position within a string. Note that in that
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    444       case <code>utf8::prior</code> may not detect an invalid UTF-8 sequence in some scenarios:
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

    605       This function is used to find the length (in code points) of a UTF-8 encoded
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    606       string. The reason it is called <em>distance</em>, rather than, say,
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    607       <em>length</em> is mainly because developers are used that <em>length</em> is an
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    608       O(1) function. Computing the length of an UTF-8 string is a linear operation, and
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    609       it looked better to model it after <code>std::distance</code> algorithm.
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    610     </p>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    611     <p>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    612       In case of an invalid UTF-8 seqence, a <code>utf8::invalid_utf8</code> exception is
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    613       thrown. If <code>last</code> does not point to the past-of-end of a UTF-8 seqence,
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
    614       a <code>utf8::not_enough_room</code> exception is thrown.

   1715     </h4>

   1716     <p>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1717       The library was designed to be:
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1718     </p>

   1719     <ol>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1720       <li>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1721         Generic: for better or worse, there are many C++ string classes out there, and
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1722         the library should work with as many of them as possible.
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1723       </li>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1724       <li>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1725         Portable: the library should be portable both accross different platforms and
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1726         compilers. The only non-portable code is a small section that declares unsigned
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1727         integers of different sizes: three typedefs. They can be changed by the users of
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1728         the library if they don't match their platform. The default setting should work
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1729         for Windows (both 32 and 64 bit), and most 32 bit and 64 bit Unix derivatives.
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1730       </li>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1731       <li>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1732         Lightweight: follow the "pay only for what you use" guideline.
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1733       </li>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1734       <li>
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
   1735         Unintrusive: avoid forcing any particular design or even programming style on the
09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]

   1737       </li>

09b24f4aa9de5c089e78b5a0d819e93b0a62cdc7[Wed 14 May 2014 10:07:01 -0700][Nelson Elhage <nelhage@nelhage.com>]
